intro: Senecio niveoplanus, commonly known as the snow flatleaf, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has thick, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its white or pale blue flowers bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its rugged habitat. Senecio niveoplanus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
